questions.question: AF-S / One-Shot AF is best for:
options: Still subjects (locks focus once, then beeps)
questions.reviewHint: AF-S/One-Shot = lock focus once for static subjects.

questions.question: AF-C / AI-Servo is designed to:
options: Lock and hold focus after the first press
Continuously adjust focus while the subject moves
Disable the shutter if focus isn't perfect

questions.question: AF-A / AI-Focus usually:
questions.reviewHint: AF-A can switch modes but can misjudge motion.

questions.question: For a static portrait, which focus area gives the most precise control?
questions.reviewHint: Single-point = most precise; aim at the eye.

questions.question: For children running erratically outdoors, a good starting setup is:
questions.reviewHint: Moving subjects → AF-C and a slightly larger area.

questions.question: Face/Eye Detect AF is most helpful when:
options: Shooting portraits; it can prioritize eyes automatically
questions.reviewHint: Use Face/Eye AF for people; it finds eyes for you.

questions.question: A risk of focus-and-recompose at wide apertures is:
questions.reviewHint: Reframing changes the distance/angle → may miss focus.

questions.question: Back-Button Focus (BBF) mainly helps you:
options: Separate focusing from the shutter—no refocus every shot
questions.reviewHint: BBF = thumb focuses, shutter just takes the photo.

questions.question: When might manual focus be the better choice?
questions.reviewHint: For stars/very low light, use manual and magnify.

questions.question: If the lens won't focus because the subject is too close, you should:
options: Step back (beyond minimum focus distance) or use a macro lens
questions.reviewHint: Every lens has a minimum focus distance.

questions.question: The focus limiter switch on some lenses:
options: Restricts the focus range to speed up AF
questions.reviewHint: Limiting range = faster focus hunts less.

questions.question: In Continuous AF, choosing Focus Priority (vs Release Priority) means:
options: Camera fires as fast as possible even if out of focus
Camera prefers in-focus shots, may slow the burst
questions.reviewHint: Focus priority = higher keeper rate, slower speed.

questions.question: The AF-assist lamp is used to:
options: Help AF lock in low light (can be distracting/can be turned off)
questions.reviewHint: AF-assist helps in dim light; disable for candid work.

questions.question: A subject walking toward you in a busy street—best area mode to start with?
questions.reviewHint: Movement toward camera → AF-C + tracking is forgiving.
